intro: Gagea lacaitae, commonly known as the Sierra Valley gagea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. It produces small, spherical berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Gagea lacaitae is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
